text:
Social networks started in the early 2000's with Facebook and twitter, today they are part of majority of people in their daily lives. Social networks are platforms for connecting individuals online. We can see on social networks posts like pictures, videos or personals texts... The most famous networks are sources of information in their own right. Stars, politicians... everyone are today on social networks. Consequently, social networks are essential in the field of communication and actuality. Communities and individuals are always bombarded with different messages. It's not only products that are shown but also what is sensed to be good and not, moods, attitudes...
 Groups produce divergent interpretation in terms on age, gender, religious... More and more we see the youngest having access to social networks. It should have an age limit because a teenager is not built enough to say that is good and that is bad on what he sees on social networks. Social networks influence those who are less informed and people who don't relied on their personal experience, or their own reasoning.
With social networks people combine the other ways to think of, they interact with media to create their own meanings out of images and messages they receive. We can called these people active people. And social networks can be a good way to stay informed bc on television or even in newspaper ideas are often the same and politically driven, while on social networks there are divergent opinions where you can debate and make your own opinion on the actuality ect... Unfortunately with creation of an algorithm on social networks, we will be forced without knowing it to see things, ideas that are similar, therefore we lose this idea of divergent opinions, it can be anxious and we risk forgetting that our way of thinking isn't the only and isn't necessarily judged as good.
